headline: S&P 500 Gains & Losses Today: PayPal Stock Drops as Index Retreats From Record
summary: The S&P 500 slid 0.3% on Friday, July 11, 2025, retreating from record levels after President Trump announced a 35% tariff on imports from Canada.

headline: The Stock Market Is Doing Worse Than It Looks Today
summary: The market is doing even worse than the S&P 500’s 0.2% decline would suggest.  With roughly 371 S&P 500 stocks on the decline, the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF was down 0.5%.  Big Tech stocks, including Amazon.com and Nvidia, were countering the broader slide.

headline: US oil/gas rig count down for 11th week to lowest since 2021, Baker Hughes says
summary: (Reuters) -U.S. energy firms this week cut the number of oil and natural gas rigs operating for an 11th week in a row for the first time since July 2020 when the COVID-19 pandemic cut demand for the fuel, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.  The oil and gas rig count, an early indicator of future output, fell by two to 537 in the week to July 11, the lowest since October 2021.  Baker Hughes said this week's decline puts the total rig count down 47 rigs, or 8% below this time last year.

headline: U.S. Oil Rigs Continue to Slump On Price Uncertainty
summary: The total number of active oil and gas drilling rigs in the United States has decreased again this week, alongside a dip in weekly US crude oil production.
